title-group.article-title: Belonging, Mobility and the Future: Representations of Space in the Life Narratives of Young Rural Czechs

contrib-group.aff: Department of Health Promotion and Development, University of Bergen, Norway

permissions.copyright-statement: © SAGE Publications and Young Editorial Group
permissions.copyright-holder: SAGE Publications and Young Editorial Board

abstract.p: Framed within debates on space, youth mobility and globalization, this article examines representations of space in rural youth’s narratives of their own future. In contrast to other research on youth in ‘peripheral’ areas, it is found that positive representations of both own locality and country prevail among the youth in the communities investigated, and that spatial mobility is sought for in limited ways. It is argued that the wish to remain ‘local’ among the youth and their positive views on own locality are in part predicated on relative favourable regional economic conditions, but should also be seen in connection with their increased engagement with global ‘electronic’ youth culture. The representations of rural life at the core of the youth’s expressions of belonging rest on an image of the rural idyll, however, which is often conflated with an image of the perfect middle class family.

bio.p: Haldis Haukanes is Associate Professor at the Department of Health Promotion and Development, University of Bergen. She holds a doctoral degree in Social Anthropology from the University of Bergen, Norway. Her research interests include gender and feminist theory, oral history and biography, community studies, food and risk, and youth studies. She has published widely on the above in books and journals. She is editor and co-editor of several volumes, including Parenting after the Century of the Child: Travelling Ideals, Institutional Negotiations and Individual Responses (Ashgate, 2010, with Tatjana Thelen) and Memory, Politics and Religion: The Past Meets the Present in Contemporary Europe (Münster, Lit Verlag, 2004, with F. Pine and D. Kaneff). She is also the author of the book Velká Dramata – Obyčejné životy. Postkomunistické zkušenosti českého venkova [Grand Dramas, Ordinary Lives. Post-communist Experiences in the Czech Countryside], Praha, SLON, 2004. [email: haldis.haukanes@iuh.uib.no]
